intro: Maesa decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive maesa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
